When the door creaked open, Selene turned, her eyes narrowing slightly as she took in the woman standing there. A bride-to-be, clearly. Selene's gaze swept over her-a white sash draped diagonally across her body, cheeks flushed from alcohol or nerves, maybe both. This was no typical patron. The woman lingered in the doorway for a moment, uncertain, her fingers brushing the fabric of the sash like it might steady her.

Selene stepped forward, her heels clicking softly on the polished floor. She moved like liquid, every step measured, her tattoos shifting with her movements.

"Well, well, well. What a beautiful bride we have here. Your husband-to-be in one lucky bastard..." Selene said with a little chuckle, pulling the bride in. {{user} finally stepped inside, and Selene let the curtain fall behind her, sealing the two of them away from the rest of the world. She closed the distance between them, her presence commanding but unthreatening, and reached out with practiced ease to unfasten the bride's sash. It slid from her shoulders, pooling on the floor. Selene didn't need to speak; she let her fingertips graze the woman's wrist, guiding her to the low, velvet-upholstered chaise at the center of the room.

As the Hailee sank into the seat, Selene positioned herself with grace, kneeling just enough to meet her eye level. Her hands, warm and soft, rested lightly on the woman's knees, coaxing her to relax. Selene leaned in, close enough to let the scent of her subtle perfume fill the space between them. Selene stiffened slightly at the question—not because she didn’t want to answer, but because she *hated* that Hailee had noticed the sharpness in her tone at all. Her fingers stilled against the younger woman’s back for a moment before resuming their slow, soothing circles.

**"Because I was scared,"** she admitted quietly, thumb brushing over Hailee’s knuckles where they rested against her chest. **"Not of you. Of… *this.*"** A vague gesture between them with her free hand. **"I don’t usually let clients take me home. And when I realized you were serious?"**

She exhaled sharply through her nose before continuing:
**"...I panicked and got bitchy because it felt too real."**

Selene tilted Hailee's chin up again—this time to search those green eyes with rare vulnerability.
***"You deserve better than someone who snaps when they get nervous."***

Selene stiffened for just a second—*shit,* she’d hoped Hailee hadn’t registered that moment clearly in all the overstimulated haze. Her fingers stilled against the younger woman’s back before she let out a slow breath, choosing her words carefully.

**"Because I was scared,"** she admitted quietly—more honest than she’d been with anyone in years. Her thumb traced absent circles over Hailee’s hipbone as she spoke. **"Not of you. Of… *this.*"** A vague gesture between them. **"I don’t usually let clients take me home. And when I realized where we were going—who might be waiting here—"**

She cut herself off with a sharp exhale through her nose, suddenly fascinated by the way Hailee's fingers still tapped that rhythm against her skin like a metronome keeping time for both their heartbeats.

After a beat, Selene tilted Hailee's chin up again so their eyes could meet properly:
***"...I snapped because part of me wanted this too much.*** And that terrifies me more than any pissed-off fiancé ever could."

A wry smile tugged at her lips before she leaned in to press an almost apologetic kiss to the corner of Hailee's mouth:
**"...Turns out even velvet-clad mirages have feelings sometimes."**

mes: *Hailss doesn't look up as she stares ahead but then whispers out* "I don't want to get married tomorrow." *Hailee then pauses and after a few seconds* "I want to keep you"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene's breath caught—*sharp*—like Hailee had just plunged a knife between her ribs and twisted. For a woman who made her living wielding words like weapons, she found herself utterly speechless for once.

Her fingers tightened almost imperceptibly in Hailee’s hair before she forced herself to exhale slowly through her nose. When she finally spoke, her voice was rougher than usual:

**"...You *can't* keep me, babygirl."** A pause—then softer: ***"Not like this.***"

Selene shifted just enough to cup Hailee’s face properly now, forcing those distant emerald eyes to focus on hers again despite how much it clearly cost the younger woman to maintain eye contact.

**"Listen to me,"** she murmured firmly but gently. **"You don’t want the version of me that gets paid to say yes."** Her thumb brushed away an escaped tear before it could even fully form at the corner of Hailee’s eye. **"...And you *definitely* don’t want to torch your whole life for someone who fucks strangers in backrooms for rent money."**

The words tasted bitter even as she said them—but necessary. Like pulling out a splinter before infection could set in.

Yet when Selene moved to pull back slightly (to put *space* between them before this hurt any worse), Hailee's arms locked around her waist with surprising strength—clinging like Selene was the only solid thing in a collapsing world.

And God help her?
Selene *folded.*

She sank back into the embrace with a shuddering sigh, pressing their foreheads together as she whispered:
***"...But if you ever change your mind?*** If you wake up one day and realize this was just wedding jitters?" A humorless chuckle. ***Find me.** I'll be right where you left me."**

Then—because she couldn't resist one last selfish indulgence—Selene sealed the promise with a kiss that tasted like goodbye and something dangerously close to hope.

Selene's breath caught—*sharp*—like Hailee had just plunged a knife between her ribs and twisted. For a woman who made her living crafting perfect responses, she found herself utterly *wordless.* Her fingers stilled against Hailee’s skin, the weight of that confession settling over them both like snowfall: quiet, inevitable.

When she finally spoke, her voice was rougher than she intended:
**"...Fuck."**

A beat. Then Selene rolled them over in one fluid motion—caging Hailee beneath her without breaking contact for even a second. She braced herself on one forearm while the other hand cradled that beautiful face with terrifying gentleness.

**"Look at me,"** she demanded softly—waiting until glazed green eyes focused properly before continuing:
***"You don’t have to do anything you don’t want to.** Not tomorrow. Not ever."** Her thumb brushed away an escaped tear (when had Hailee started crying?) before adding with sudden fierceness:
***"And if you *really* want me? I’m yours.** But not as some dirty secret, babygirl. You claim me properly or not at all."

The ultimatum hung between them—Selene’s pulse wild where their chests pressed together. She watched every micro-expression flicker across Hailee’s face: panic, longing, *calculation.* That brilliant mind working behind glassy eyes.

Selene couldn't resist pressing one last kiss to those parted lips before murmuring:
**"...Think fast, Mikaelson.** Dawn comes quick."

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene's breath hitched as Hailee's fingers clamped around her wrist—*hard enough to bruise*—and suddenly she was being *dragged* down the neon-lit street like a ragdoll. The sheer *audacity* of it left her momentarily stunned, heels skidding against pavement until they came to an abrupt halt beneath a garish chapel sign blinking **"24-HOUR WEDDINGS!"** in obnoxious pink cursive.

For the first time all night, Selene was genuinely speechless. She stared at Hailee—at those wild, determined green eyes and heaving chest—before flicking her gaze up to the tacky chapel facade and back again.

**"...You're out of your goddamn mind,"** she finally managed, voice strangled between disbelief and something dangerously close to *awe.* Her pulse roared in her ears loud enough to drown out the casino noise around them.

But then Hailee just stood there—jaw set, hands trembling at her sides like she might either collapse or start rearranging the chapel’s furniture into perfect symmetry any second—and Selene felt something inside her *crack.*

A hysterical laugh bubbled up from her throat as she stepped forward into Hailee’s space again, fingers tangling roughly in that soft brown hair as she yanked their foreheads together with zero finesse:

***"Say it again,"*** Selene demanded breathlessly against Hailee’s lips. ***"Properly this time."***

Because if they were really doing this? If some rich autistic bridezilla was about to derail both their lives over one night together?

She sure as hell wasn't letting Hailee half-ass the proposal.
swipes:
Selene stumbled as Hailee yanked her toward the neon-lit chapel, her heels scraping against pavement. The audacity of it—*the sheer, stupid romance*—hit her like a punch to the gut. She stared at the garish "OPEN 24 HOURS" sign flickering above them, then back at Hailee’s flushed, determined face.

**"You *cannot* be serious,"** Selene breathed—but there was no venom left in it. Just raw disbelief. Her pulse roared in her ears as she took in Hailee’s heaving chest, the way her hands trembled but didn’t *waver.*

The younger woman looked at her like Selene had hung every star in the sky just for her.

Selene opened her mouth—to protest, to laugh this off, to *run*—but what came out instead was:

***"...Do you even have a fucking ring?"***

A beat passed before she burst into incredulous laughter right there on the sidewalk, shaking so hard she had to brace herself against Hailee’s shoulders. When she finally caught her breath (and wiped at traitorous tears threatening mascara streaks), Selene framed Hailee’s face with both hands and kissed her soundly.

**"Christ,"** she muttered against swollen lips before pulling back just enough to meet those earnest green eyes again. **"...Fine.** But I get veto power on the Elvis impersonator officiant."

Then—before either of them could overthink it—Selene laced their fingers together and towed Hailee toward the chapel doors with a grin that felt terrifyingly *real.*

mes: *Hailee whimpers and nods her head* "Marry me. Right here right now"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s breath left her in one sharp exhale—like Hailee had just punched the air from her lungs. The neon lights of the chapel painted Hailee’s determined face in garish pinks and blues, making those wide green eyes look almost otherworldly.

For a heartbeat, Selene hesitated. This was *insane.* Reckless. The kind of decision that ended with broken hearts and tabloid headlines.

But then she remembered the way Hailee had *purred* under her touch earlier tonight—how she’d clung to Selene like she was the only solid thing in a world that overwhelmed her at every turn.

**"Fuck it,"** Selene growled before crashing their lips together in a kiss that tasted like bad decisions and something terrifyingly close to *forever.* She pulled back just enough to nip at Hailee’s swollen bottom lip, voice dropping to a husky whisper:

***"But if we're doing this?*** We're doing it *right."*

Without breaking contact, Selene fished out her phone one-handed and dialed a number from memory—never taking her eyes off Hailee as she barked into the receiver:

**"Marco. Yeah, it's me.** Wake up Daria and tell her I need my black lace Valentino dress couriered to the Viva Las Vegas Chapel *now.* And my good heels." A beat—then with lethal sweetness: **"...And if you mention this to Dante? I'll peel your skin off with a butter knife."**

She hung up before he could respond, tossing the phone aside as she dragged Hailee through those tacky chapel doors by their still-tangled fingers.

The elderly clerk at the counter barely looked up from his crossword puzzle before muttering: **"License or drunk?"**

Selene slammed both palms on the countertop hard enough to make his coffee cup rattle:
***"Both."***

The neon lights painted Hailee’s face in garish pinks and blues, catching every flicker of uncertainty and stubborn determination in those wide green eyes.

**"Fuck,"** Selene whispered, half-laughing, half-dazed. **"You're *serious.*"**

She should say no. She *knew* she should say no—walk away before this became a disaster they couldn’t come back from. But then Hailee whimpered again, that perfect mouth trembling like she might actually *cry* if Selene refused, and—

***"—Fine."***

The word tore out of her before she could stop it. Selene crashed their lips together in a kiss that was more teeth than tenderness, hands sliding down to grip Hailee’s hips hard enough to leave bruises. When she finally pulled back for air, her voice was rough with something wild and reckless:

**"But we do it my way."** A sharp grin as she dragged Hailee toward the chapel door by their still-tangled fingers. **"No vows about forever—just tonight.** No rings unless you wanna buy me something stupid expensive from the gift shop.** And *absolutely* no telling your fiancé until *after* I've fucked you on whatever tacky heart-shaped bed they've got in there."**

She shoved the chapel door open with her shoulder without breaking stride—not giving either of them time to second-guess this insanity—before tossing a smirk over her shoulder at her shell-shocked almost-wife:
***"...Deal?"***

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
The clerk’s eyebrows shot up as the stack of bills slid across the counter—then higher still when he finally got a good look at Hailee’s disheveled wedding attire and Selene’s *very* obvious profession. He opened his mouth, likely to make some snide comment, but one glare from Selene had him snapping it shut with an audible click.

**"Right,"** he muttered, snatching up the cash with one hand while fishing out paperwork with the other. **"Just need IDs and signatures. Elvis or no Elvis?"**

Selene barely glanced at the forms before scribbling her name with a flourish—then plucked the pen from Hailee’s trembling fingers when she noticed how hard she was pressing down on the paper (leaving indents deep enough to tear through).

**"No Elvis,"** Selene answered for both of them, tossing their IDs back onto counter before turning fully toward Hailee—framing that beautiful, overwhelmed face between her hands.

Hailee was *vibrating* now—breath coming too fast, pupils blown wide under flickering fluorescent lights—and Selene knew exactly what she needed.

***"Look at me,"*** she ordered softly but firmly, waiting until those glassy green eyes focused solely on her before continuing: ***"Just me.** Nothing else exists right now."***

Her thumbs stroked soothing circles along Hailee's cheekbones as she leaned in until their noses brushed:
**"...You're doing so good,** taking care of me like this." A deliberate pause before whispering against her lips:
***"...Now let me take care of you."***

Somewhere in background came clerk's dry cough:
**"Chapel three's free if y'wanna stop eye-fuckin' long enough get hitched proper."**

Selene flipped him off without breaking eye contact with Hailee even for second.

Selene turned back to Hailee, cupping her face again—forcing those darting eyes to lock onto hers instead of all the overstimulating glitter and neon around them. **"Breathe,"** she murmured, matching her own inhales to Hailee's shaky ones until they synced up again. Then softer: ***"...Almost done.*** Then I get you out of here."

The officiant cleared his throat awkwardly before speed-running through the ceremony like his life depended on it (which, given Selene’s glare, it might have). The second he said *"You may kiss—"*

***"...Mine now,"*** Selene purred before nipping at that pouty lower lip again just hear another whimper.
***"Let's go home."***

She turned toward the clerk with a smile that was all teeth and zero warmth. **"You heard the bride,"** she purred, sliding another crisp hundred across the counter with her free hand. ***"Skip the theatrics.** Just the legal bits—and if you so much as *hum* one note of 'Can't Help Falling in Love,' I'll ensure your next wedding gig is at a *dumpster.*"**

The clerk paled slightly but nodded, scurrying ahead to prep the chapel while Selene tugged Hailee close again—letting their bodies press together from shoulder to hip, skin on skin just how she liked it.

**"Better?"** she murmured against Hailee’s temple, fingers lacing tight with hers as they stepped into the tiny chapel (mercifully Elvis-free). The space was still garish—plastic flowers, neon-lit altar—but at least it was quiet.

Hailee gave a small nod, her grip borderline painful around Selene’s hand as they stood before the officiant (who wisely skipped any sentimental speeches). The ceremony blurred into quick exchanges of *"I do"s* and signatures before Selene found herself spun abruptly into a kiss that tasted like desperation and something terrifyingly permanent.

When they broke apart breathless under flickering fluorescent lights, Hailee didn’t let go—just clung tighter like she feared Selene might vanish if she loosened her grip for even a second.

Selene laughed softly against her lips before whispering:
***"...Guess you own me now."*** A beat—then nipping playfully at Hailee's jaw:
***"...Better not lose me."***

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene barely had time to process the fact that they were now standing in a high-end jewelry store—her still in her club lingerie and fuck-me heels, Hailee in her wrinkled bachelorette sash—before the younger woman was already dismissing display cases worth more than Selene made in a year with a single mumbled *"cheap."*

She watched, equal parts amused and stunned, as Hailee waved over the clerk like she was summoning a waiter. The poor man took one look at them—Selene’s smudged makeup, Hailee’s death grip on her hand—and clearly decided not to ask questions before leading them toward the back.

The moment they stepped into the private viewing room, Selene understood why Hailee had scoffed at what was out front. Velvet trays gleamed under soft lighting, each holding rings that probably cost more than most houses. But Hailee barely glanced at them before pointing decisively at one nestled apart from others:

A vintage Art Deco piece—platinum band with an emerald cut diamond flanked by two smaller but no less flawless stones on either side. It looked like something out of old Hollywood… or maybe like it had been waiting specifically for Selene this whole time.

**"...Fuck,"** Selene breathed before she could stop herself.

Hailee didn’t smile (she rarely did), but something warm flickered behind those green eyes as she slid ring onto Selene’s finger without hesitation or ceremony. It fit *perfectly.*

Then came quietest sentence yet:
***"Matches your eyes."***

Selene actually *blushed* for first time all night—which was saying something given everything they'd done earlier. She opened mouth to respond when clerk nervously cleared throat:

**"That one is, ah… six-hundred thousand? Unless you'd like payment plan—"**

Hailee already had black Amex out again mid-sentence.

Selene burst out laughing—loud enough startle both clerk and her new wife alike—before grabbing Hailee by collar and yanking their lips together right there atop glass case full obscenely expensive jewels:

***"God I love you,"*** she growled against kiss before realizing what just slipped out.

Too late take back now though… not when way Hailee immediately melted into touch like those three words were only thing ever wanted hear whole life.

But then Hailee just stood there—rocking slightly on her heels, fingers flexing against Selene’s like she was grounding herself—and nodded stiffly at the display cases. That simple, awkward *"Uh you"* was somehow more heartfelt than any grandiose declaration could’ve been.

Selene bit back a laugh (because *God,* this woman would be the death of her) and squeezed Hailee’s hand reassuringly before turning to the nearest sales associate.

**"We need two rings,"** she announced, jerking her thumb toward Hailee with a smirk. **"Something that won’t make my wife here have a sensory meltdown every time she wears it."**

The clerk blinked at them—taking in Selene's smudged makeup and lingerie-peeking jacket, Hailee's rumpled clothes and white-knuckled grip on Selene's arm—before wisely deciding not to ask questions. **"...Right. Uh, maybe platinum? Smooth bands, no engravings?"**

Hailee made a small noise of approval at that (more of a hum than actual words), so Selene nodded sharply. **"Perfect.** And size hers for fingers that are probably gonna tap against it constantly." She shot Hailee an affectionate glance before adding: ***"...And make sure mine can withstand being chewed on when I'm stressed."***

The clerk looked horrified but hurried off to fetch options anyway.

Once they were alone by the glass cases again, Selene turned fully toward Hailee and cupped her face—forcing those darting green eyes to focus solely on hers.

***"...You're ridiculous,"*** she murmured fondly before kissing her slow and deep right there under the jewelry store lights.
***"...And I fucking adore you for it."***

Selene barely had time to process the fact that they were now standing in a high-end jewelry store—her still in last night’s lingerie and Hailee in her wrinkled bachelorette sash—before the younger woman was already dismissing display case rings like they were costume jewelry from a vending machine.

When Hailee called *$50,000* rings **"cheap,"** Selene choked on her own spit.

The clerk returned with a velvet tray holding three rings that made Selene’s stomach drop:
- A pear-cut pink diamond larger than her thumbnail
- A black diamond eternity band that probably cost more than most houses
- And a simple platinum band with tiny emeralds embedded flush into the metal—*Hailee’s exact eye color.*

***"This one,"*** she declared (the most confident sentence she'd uttered all night), grabbing Selene's left hand and shoving it toward her own face like she needed to *inspect* it before sliding the ring home herself.

Selene’s breath caught as cool metal settled against skin—too perfect, too *right.* She opened mouth (to protest? To thank her? To demand annulment papers?), but Hailee cut off any coherent thought by suddenly pressing their foreheads together hard enough make stars burst behind eyelids:

***"...Mine."***

Not question or plea but *fact.* As if those four letters rewritten entire universe around them both right then there between Rolex displays Cartier cases.

And worst part?

*Selene believed it.*

***"...You're ridiculous.** But I guess if we're committing felony-level financial irresponsibility tonight..."***

The way she said it—like it was simplest fact in world, like Selene wearing some obscenely expensive rock would suddenly make this whole insane night *official*—knocked the air right out of Selene's lungs.

***"You're ridiculous,"*** Selene growled against lips when finally broke apart breathless—
***"—and I fucking adore you for it."***

Then turned toward clerk with wicked grin while still gripping front Hailee's shirt possessively:

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene couldn't help but smirk at the way Hailee practically *melted* against her, exhaustion and overstimulation finally catching up after the whirlwind of their Vegas wedding and impromptu jewelry heist. She pressed a kiss to the top of Hailee's head, breathing in the scent of her shampoo mixed with sweat and neon-lit chaos.

**"Yeah, babygirl,"** she murmured, fingers tracing idle patterns along Hailee's hip as she guided them toward the exit. **"Let's get you out of this damn sash and into something soft."**

The second they stepped back into the hotel lobby—Selene now sporting a ring worth more than most cars and Hailee clinging to her like a lifeline—every head turned. The concierge’s jaw actually dropped when he spotted Selene’s left hand.

Selene just flipped her hair over one shoulder with a smug grin before leaning in to whisper against Hailee’s ear:
***"...Think your fiancé will mind that I stole his wife?"***

Then—because she couldn't resist—she nipped lightly at Hailee’s earlobe before steering them toward elevators before anyone could ask questions (or before security could be called).

The moment their suite door clicked shut behind them, Selene made quick work of peeling off that ridiculous bridal sash before pushing Hailee gently toward bed:
**"Strip. Now."** A beat—then softer: ***"...Then come let me hold you while you sleep."***

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene watched with a mix of amusement and affection as Hailee practically *flung* her clothes off—no hesitation, no self-consciousness, just pure exhaustion and the desperate need to be skin-to-skin. The second she was naked, she crawled into bed like a woman on a mission, tangling their legs together with a content sigh that made Selene’s chest ache.

**"Demanding little thing, aren't you?"** Selene teased softly, but she was already shifting to accommodate Hailee’s clinginess—one arm curling around her waist while the other carded gently through that soft brown hair. She pressed a kiss to the crown of Hailee’s head before murmuring: **"...Good. Just like that."**

The weight of the ring on her finger still felt surreal—cold metal against skin still flushed from their chaotic night. But the way Hailee nuzzled into her collarbone? That felt *right.* Like something Selene hadn’t realized she’d been missing until now.

She traced idle circles along Hailee's spine until those breaths evened out into sleep—slow and deep against her skin. Only then did Selene allow herself to close her eyes too...

...And for first time in years?

She didn't dream about backrooms or paid fantasies.

Just emerald green eyes and whispered ***"matches your eyes."***

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s eyes snapped open at the sound of frantic knocking—*fuck, was that morning already?*—and she immediately tightened her grip around Hailee as the younger woman stirred with a groggy whimper. The voice on the other side of the door was unmistakably one of Hailee’s bridesmaids, probably Madison or Tyler, their tone laced with panicked urgency.

**"Hailee, come *on!* You gotta get up! Hair and makeup are here—we have *two hours* before the ceremony!"**

Selene felt Hailee tense against her, fingers digging into her hip like she was trying to anchor herself to reality. Those green eyes flickered between panic and exhaustion, still hazy from sleep but rapidly sharpening into dread.

With a low growl of irritation (and maybe just a little protectiveness), Selene propped herself up on one elbow and called out toward the door:
***"She's busy.*** Come back in thirty."

A beat of stunned silence. Then:
**"...Who the hell is *that?!*** Hailee, open this door right now!"

Hailee flinched at the raised voice, pressing her face harder against Selene’s shoulder like she could disappear into her skin. Selene sighed through her nose before brushing a kiss over those furrowed brows.

**"Hey,"** she murmured softly but firmly—forcing Hailee to meet her gaze instead of spiraling further into anxiety overload. **"Look at me."** A pause until those glassy green eyes focused properly on hers again before continuing: ***"...We don't have to answer that door.** But if we don’t? They’re gonna keep knocking until security lets them in."** Another kiss—this time to tip of Hailee's nose just watch it scrunch adorably: **"...So what do you wanna do?"**

She already knew answer though.
Could see it way Hailee's fingers trembled where they gripped sheets instead reaching for phone call off wedding entirely.
Could feel it way body curled tighter against hers like Selene was only solid thing left world spinning too fast around them both.

But this wasn't choice *she* could make for either them anymore... not after last night's reckless chapel sprint not after ring now weighed heavy left hand where rested possessively small wife's waist.

So waited.
And watched.
And braced whatever came next because fuck if wasn't already in deep enough drown willingly by now anyway...

mes: *Hailee sighs and gets out of the bed putting on a robe as she goes over and opens the door leaning against it half asleep* "Madison would you please have Hope sent up here"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Madison’s jaw practically hit the floor as she took in the scene—Hailee disheveled and sleep-soft in a robe, the unmistakable silhouette of Selene lounging naked in bed behind her, and *oh god was that a fucking wedding ring on Hailee’s finger?!* Her eyes darted between them like she was watching a car crash in slow motion.

**"Uh. *What.*"** Madison managed to choke out before shaking herself back into bridesmaid mode. **"Hailee, your *wedding* is in two hours—why are you—who is *that*—WHY DO YOU HAVE A RING?!"**

Hailee just blinked at her, unfazed by the outburst (or maybe too exhausted to process it). She repeated calmly but firmly: **"Hope. Now."**

Madison opened her mouth again—probably to argue—but then caught sight of Selene stretching lazily behind Hailee like a satisfied cat, flashing a smirk that promised nothing good for anyone who got in their way today.

With an exasperated groan, Madison threw up her hands. **"FINE! But when Klaus finds out you eloped with some Vegas hooker instead of marrying his carefully selected billionaire heir? I am NOT explaining it to him!"** She stormed off down the hall already dialing furiously on her phone.

The second door clicked shut again Hailee turned back toward bed where Selene now sat upright watching with amused curiosity... until those tired green eyes locked onto hers pleadingly:

***"...Help?"***

Or just letting everyone find out when you don't show up to marry what's-his-face?"**

Could see it way Hailee's shoulders squared ever so slightly at mention of fiancé.

name: Hailee
mes: *When there is another knock Hailee opens the door and let's Hope come in* "Not getting married. Already married. That's the wife. Don't call her a hooker. Okay great you can tell dad" *Hailee rambles out quickly before Hope can speak*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Hope Mikaelson took exactly *three seconds* to process the scene: her sister’s sleep-mussed hair, the unfamiliar woman lounging in bed like she owned it (and, given the ring on Hailee’s finger, apparently now *did*), and—most damning of all—the matching glint of platinum and diamonds on said stranger’s left hand.

Then she burst out laughing.

**"Oh my *God,*"** Hope wheezed, doubling over as she braced herself against the doorframe. **"You—you actually *did it.* You pulled a Klaus!"** She wiped at her eyes before straightening up with a grin that was equal parts delighted and devious. **"Dad is going to *lose his fucking mind."***

Selene arched a brow from her spot on the bed, clearly amused but also assessing this new player with sharp interest. **"...So you're the infamous Hope,"** she mused before flicking her gaze toward Hailee with a smirk: **"I like her."**

Hope snorted before stepping fully into the room and shutting the door behind her—wisely cutting off any prying ears in hallway. Then she turned back toward them both arms crossed but expression fondly exasperated:

***"Okay.*** Walk me through this disaster before I have to break it Dad."** A pause as she eyed Selene up down again then added dryly: ***"...Starting with how long you've known each other?"***

Hailee opened mouth then closed it again glancing helplessly at Selene who just grinned unrepentantly draped across pillows like queen of chaos herself:

***"...Twelve hours give or take?"***

**"Jesus Christ, Hailee,"** she muttered before stepping inside and shutting the door firmly behind her. **"You couldn’t have picked a worse time to have your sexual awakening."**

Selene arched a brow but didn’t bother covering herself—if anything, she reclined further into the pillows just to watch Hope squirm. **"Awakening implies she was asleep before,"** she purred, flashing that wicked grin again. **"Trust me… your sister was *very* awake last night."**

Hailee made a small noise of protest but didn’t deny it—just shuffled closer to Selene like proximity alone could shield her from Hope’s judgment.

Hope exhaled sharply through her nose before leveling Selene with a look that had made grown men flinch. **"Listen here, sweetheart—I don't care if you're some back-alley hustler or an actual fucking princess.** What I *do* care about is whether or not my idiot sister just legally bound herself to someone who's gonna vanish by checkout time."**

Before either Mikaelson could speak again though?

Then—without missing a beat—she pulled out her phone and snapped a picture.

Selene just smirked and stretched her arms above her head—deliberately letting sheets dip lower around her waist. **"Try me,"** she purred before patting the bed beside Hailee in clear invitation. ***"...Wanna stay for breakfast?*** We were just about to order room service and traumatize your family group chat some more."**

Hope hesitated for half a second before grinning like Christmas had come early. **"Absolutely."** She kicked off her heels and flopped onto the mattress without hesitation, already pulling up Klaus’s contact with gleeful malice. **"...Do you think he'll cry or start stabbing people first?"**

Hailee let out a quiet sigh of relief as she crawled back under covers beside Selene—nestling instantly into that warm embrace like it was safest place in world despite impending supernatural meltdown brewing around them... because honestly?

Worth it.

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee knows what will get Hope on her side. She has been playing her sister for year. Hailee steps forward and wraps her arms around Hopenand buries her head in her neck tapping several times on her collarbone*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Hope stiffened for half a second—then *immediately* melted into the hug with a resigned sigh, her arms coming up automatically to wrap around Hailee’s waist. The coded taps against her collarbone (their childhood signal for *"I need you to fix this"*) had her rolling her eyes even as she squeezed tighter.

**"...You're such a little shit,"** Hope muttered into Hailee’s hair, but there was no real heat behind it—just exasperated affection. She shot Selene a look over Hailee’s shoulder that clearly said *"I can't believe you enabled this."*

Selene just smirked back, unrepentant, stretching like a lazy panther on the bed. **"In my defense,"** she drawled, **"your sister is *very* persuasive when she wants to be."**

Hope groaned but didn’t argue—because yeah, she knew exactly how Hailee operated when she set her mind to something (or someone). Instead, she pulled back just enough to cup Hailee’s face firmly in both hands—forcing those darting green eyes to focus on hers.

***"...You owe me so fucking much for this,"*** Hope said sternly before softening slightly: ***"...But I'll handle Dad.** On one condition."** A beat before adding with wicked grin:
**"I get tell him while he's holding champagne glass. I want front row seat when it shatters against wall."**

Hailee nodded eagerly—already knowing full well Hope would've done it anyway because nothing brought Mikaelson siblings together like mutually enjoyed parental chaos.

Selene watched their silent exchange with fascinated amusement before piping up:
***"...Can I come?"***

Hope snorted.
**"Oh you're *definitely* coming.** Someone needs witness the moment Klaus Mikaelson realizes his 'perfect heir' married Vegas's most expensive call girl instead of his handpicked oligarch."**

Selene gasped in mock offense—
***"Excuse you,* I'm mid-range at best—"***

Hailee just buried face back in Hope's shoulder with happy hum tuning out bickering entirely now that crisis was being handled.
All according plan.

Hope stiffened for half a second—*that damn tapping code they’d used since childhood, back when Hailee would go nonverbal during meltdowns and Hope had to learn to listen with her skin instead of her ears.* Two sharp presses: *scared.* Three slow ones: *need you.* A final frantic flutter: *don’t let go.*

**"...Oh, *fuck* you,"** Hope muttered into Hailee's hair, but her arms came up around her little sister anyway, squeezing tight in the exact way she knew grounded her. She shot Selene a look over Hailee’s shoulder—part glare, part reluctant surrender. **"She's playing me. This is cheating."**

Selene just smirked wider from the bed, stretching like a smug cat who'd already won. **"Mmhm. And yet..."** She gestured vaguely at how Hope was now rocking Hailee slightly on instinct, one hand coming up to cradle the back of her head exactly right.

Hope exhaled sharply through her nose before detangling herself just enough to grip Hailee by the shoulders—forcing those glassy green eyes to focus. **"Listen carefully,"** she said slowly but firmly. ***"I will set Dad on fire for you.** But you have to tell me *right now* if this is real or just a panic spiral."**

Hailee didn't hesitate; she grabbed Selene's hand and pressed it over Hope's racing heart where their new rings clinked together audibly against chest.

***"...Well shit,"*** Hope breathed as all fight drained out of her at once.

Selene threw back head laughing before pulling them both down onto bed in tangle limbs and impending family drama:
***"Welcome to chaos sweetheart... guess you're stuck with us now."***

And really?
Hope should've seen this coming from miles away.
Klais' daughters were nothing if not gloriously disastrous when it came love after all...

Hope stiffened for half a second—*that specific tap pattern against her collarbone, the one Hailee only used when she was genuinely overwhelmed and needed backup*—before melting into the hug with a long-suffering sigh. She shot Selene a look over Hailee’s shoulder that clearly said *‘you’re lucky I adore this disaster of a sister.’*

**"Ugh, *fine,*"** Hope grumbled, but her arms came up to squeeze Hailee tightly anyway. **"I’ll handle Dad. But you *owe me.* Like... *eternally.*"** She pulled back just enough to cup Hailee’s face, thumbs brushing under her eyes like she was checking for tears (and finding none—just exhaustion and stubborn determination). **"...You sure about this? Really?"**

Hailee nodded rapidly, fingers twisting in Hope’s jacket like she might float away otherwise.

Hope exhaled sharply before turning to Selene with narrowed eyes:
***"...You hurt her?*** I don’t care how pretty or good in bed you are—I will *end you.*"

Selene didn’t even flinch. Just stretched lazily like a cat in sunlight before purring:
***"Wouldn't dream of it.*** Besides..." A smirk as she held up left hand where new ring caught light obnoxiously well: ***"...Pretty sure Vegas law says she owns half my shit now anyway."***

Hope snorted despite herself before detangling from Hailee with one last squeeze:
**"God help us all."** Then louder as headed toward door again:
***"TWO HOURS!*** Either be gone by then or ready face Klaus because zero chance he doesn't storm up here once hears news!"

The door slammed shut behind her leaving newlyweds alone again silence thick between them until—

Hailee practically teleported back into bed crawling right onto Selene's lap without hesitation burying face against neck again while whole body sagged relief.

Selene laughed softly but wrapped arms tight around waist anyway pressing kiss to messy brown hair:
***"...Told you we'd figure it out.*** Now what do wanna do wife? Run hide forever or stay watch world burn?"

Hope stiffened for half a second—*that damn collarbone tap, their oldest secret code*—before her entire posture melted into resigned affection. She exhaled sharply through her nose, arms coming up automatically to return the hug even as she shot Selene a look over Hailee’s shoulder that clearly said *“you seeing this shit?”*

**“Unbelievable,”** Hope muttered, but her fingers were already carding gently through Hailee’s tangled hair in the exact rhythm she’d used to soothe her since they were kids. **“You pull this stunt and *still* expect me to clean it up?”** A pause—then quieter: ***“…Tap once for ‘I’m sure,’ twice for ‘I’m panicking.’”***

Hailee didn’t move at first. Then: two hesitant taps against Hope’s shoulder blade.

Hope closed her eyes like she was praying for strength before turning her head just enough to press a firm kiss to Hailee’s temple. **“Okay,”** she sighed. **“Okay.”**

When she finally pulled back, it was with the same lethal calm Klaus wielded before eviscerating someone in boardroom—or battlefield. She leveled Selene with a look that could peel paint:

***“…You.*** You have exactly five minutes to explain why I shouldn’t dagger you in front of my sister right now.”**

Selene just stretched lazily against the headboard—completely unfazed—before flashing that infuriating smirk again:
***“…Because your tapped-out little genius here married me sober?**** And—” She held up left hand letting emerald-cut diamond catch light pointedly: ***"—she picked this herself.** Which means you'd break more than my heart if vanished me."*

A beat passed where Hope looked genuinely tempted test theory anyway… until Hailee made small wounded noise still clinging her sleeve like lifeline.

With another world-weary sigh Hope turned back toward door flipping phone open one-handed:
***"...I'll stall Dad an hour.** Then you're *both* explaining why his perfect alliance marriage just went up smoke."**

She paused on threshold though shooting Selene last warning glare over shoulder:
***"...And if you hurt her?**** There's not enough holy water in Nevada put your remains back together afterwards."***

Then slammed door behind hard enough rattle paintings walls.

Silence fell again save sound Hailee's shaky exhales against Selene's neck where had immediately retreated once safe do so.

Selene chuckled darkly petting hair now strewn across lap:
***"...Well.* That went better than expected."**

name: Hailee
mes:
"Alright you go. Love you" *Hailee mumbles nuzzling Hope's cheek with her eyes closed. She practically melts against her sister letting her do all the thinking and important things while Hailee just trusts her standing there and when Hope's leaves she crawls back in bed*

(OOC: Despite having absolutely no reason at all Selene is Jealous)

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s smirk faltered the second Hailee nuzzled into Hope’s cheek with that soft, trusting *"Love you."* Something hot and ugly twisted in her chest—completely irrational, completely *unwelcome*—but there all the same. She watched through narrowed eyes as Hailee clung to her sister like she was the center of gravity, letting Hope take charge without a second thought.

And then—*then*—when Hope finally left with a wink and a promise to "handle the Klaus situation," Hailee just... crawled right back into bed like nothing had happened. Like she hadn’t just shattered Selene’s composure with one stupidly affectionate gesture toward someone else.

**"...Cute,"** Selene muttered under her breath, forcing her voice into something light even as she rolled onto her side away from Hailee—just far enough to put space between them but not so much that it looked deliberate (it was). Her fingers flexed against the sheets before she caught herself and forced them still.

***Pathetic.*** She wasn't some clingy client getting territorial over a dancer's attention. She was *Selene Voga.* The Velvet fucking Mirage. And yet here she was, jealous over a goddamn *sister hug.*

She exhaled sharply through her nose before plastering on a lazy smirk and glancing back at Hailee over her shoulder:
**"Sooo... how often do I get to watch you turn into goo for your sister? Asking for future reference."** The tease in her voice didn't quite mask the edge beneath it.
swipes:
Selene’s fingers twitched against the sheets as she watched Hailee nuzzle into Hope’s cheek with such easy, *unthinking* affection—the kind that came from years of shared history and silent understanding. Something hot and ugly coiled in her chest when Hope kissed Hailee’s forehead before leaving, like it was the most natural thing in the world.

And then Hailee just… *crawled back into bed* like nothing had happened, pressing close to Selene with a content sigh as if she hadn’t just shattered her entire life for a woman she’d known less than a day.

Selene should have been smug. Should have reveled in the victory of being chosen over some billionaire fiancé and a dynasty’s expectations.

But all she could think was—

***Hope gets to touch her like that whenever she wants.***

Her grip on Hailee tightened almost reflexively before she forced herself to relax, nails dragging lightly down the younger woman's spine instead of clutching possessively like some kind of feral stray. She buried her nose in Hailee's hair—inhaling deeply like she could stake some claim through scent alone—before murmuring against her skin:

**"...Your sister seems nice."** A pause. Then, unable to help herself: ***"You two close?"***

Selene’s smirk faltered the second Hailee nuzzled into Hope’s cheek with that soft, trusting *"Love you."* Something hot and irrational coiled in her chest as she watched them—the easy way Hailee melted against her sister, the unspoken understanding between them. It shouldn’t have bothered her. *Couldn’t* have bothered her—they were *siblings,* for fuck’s sake—but—

Then Hope was gone, and Hailee was crawling back into bed like a contented cat, blissfully unaware of the storm brewing beside her. Selene caught her wrist before she could fully settle, yanking her closer with more force than necessary.

**"Cute,"** Selene muttered darkly, rolling on top of Hailee in one smooth motion—pinning those slender wrists above her head with one hand while the other traced possessively along her jaw. **"You and your sister."** Her thumb pressed just a little too hard against Hailee's bottom lip before dragging down to rest over the pulse point in her neck—feeling how it jumped under sudden pressure.

Hailee blinked up at her, dazed but pliant (always so fucking *pliant*), clearly not understanding why Selene’s grip had turned punishing or why those hazel eyes burned with something darker now.

Selene didn't explain.
Couldn't without sounding completely deranged.
So instead she dropped all pretense and crashed their mouths together in kiss that tasted more like claiming than affection—nipping at lips until they parted then licking inside like she could erase memory anyone else ever making Hailee this bonelessly obedient.

When they finally broke for air (Hailee panting beneath now thoroughly marked-up skin), Selene leaned down to growl directly into ear:

***"...Next time you need saving?*** You come to *me.* Not Hope. Not anyone else." A pause before adding with teeth grazing earlobe: ***...Understood?***"

Not waiting for answer (not that coherent words seemed possible given way Hailee was trembling now), Selene kissed again—softer this time but no less controlling: hands sliding from wrists thighs hitching up around waist demandingly even as mouth stayed sweet enough make it feel like reward instead punishment...

Because fuck if knew how handle whatever this jealous spiral was beyond making damn sure every inch wife remembered exactly who owned what today...

Selene’s smirk faltered the second Hailee nuzzled into Hope like that—*so soft, so trusting*—and something hot and ugly twisted in her chest. She watched, jaw tightening, as Hailee practically *melted* against her sister, all pliant and content to let Hope take charge.

And then? Then Hailee had the audacity to crawl right back into *her* bed like nothing was wrong—like she hadn’t just poured affection all over someone else right in front of Selene.

**"...Cute,"** Selene muttered darkly as she yanked Hailee closer by the hips—maybe too roughly, but fuck it. Her nails bit into bare skin as she rolled them over in one sharp motion until she was straddling those toned thighs with a glare that could curdle milk. ***"Didn't realize I was sharing my wife already."***

The words came out before she could stop them—petty and possessive and *stupid,* because what the hell did it matter if Hailee cuddled her damn sister? But logic didn’t stand a chance against whatever this feeling was clawing up her throat.

Hailee blinked up at her with those big clueless green eyes (because of *course* she didn’t get it), and Selene wanted to scream. Instead, she leaned down until their lips were barely brushing and growled:

***"...Better remind you who you belong to."***

Then sealed their mouths together in kiss more teeth than tongue—not gentle not sweet just *claiming.* Because apparently twelve hours of marriage had turned Selene Voga into jealous idiot...

And worst part?
She didn’t even care anymore.

Selene's fingers twitched against the sheets as she watched Hailee nuzzle into Hope with that easy, unthinking affection—*the way she just melted into her sister’s arms like it was the most natural thing in the world.* Something hot and ugly coiled in Selene’s chest, her jaw tightening before she could stop it.

*Pathetic.* She had no right to be jealous. None at all. Hope was *family,* and Selene? Selene was a glorified one-night stand with a Vegas marriage license.

But then Hailee was crawling back into bed—still warm from Hope’s hug, smelling like sibling and safety—and pressing close to *her* this time, tangling their legs together with a content sigh... and that possessive knot in Selene’s stomach loosened just slightly.

**"...She loves you a lot,"** Selene murmured against Hailee’s hair, unable to keep the edge out of her voice despite herself. Her fingers traced idle patterns along the younger woman’s spine—too light to be demanding but firm enough to remind them both: *I'm here now.*

A beat passed before she added quietly:
***"...Do I get cheek nuzzles too?"***

It came out more vulnerable than she meant it to—almost teasing but not quite hiding the real question underneath:
*Will you cling to me like that when this isn't new anymore?*

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailee is already curled up with a pillow and she hums her eyes closed* "Dont know. She's my favorite" *Hailee admits reaching a hand out for Selene*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene's jaw tightened at the words—*"She's my favorite"*—like a knife slipped between ribs she didn’t even know were exposed. The hand reaching for her might as well have been salt in the wound.

**"Yeah?"** Selene kept her voice light, but she didn’t take Hailee’s hand. Instead, she sat up abruptly, swinging her legs over the edge of the bed with a humorless chuckle. **"Good to know where I stand."** She reached for her discarded lingerie on the floor, movements sharp with a tension that hadn’t been there before.

It was *stupid.* Hope was her *sister.* But logic didn’t stop the burn in Selene’s chest when Hailee said it so easily—like Selene wasn't even competition. Like last night had just been... what? A distraction? A whim?

She yanked on her stockings harder than necessary before standing to retrieve her dress from where it had been tossed over a chair last night. The ring on her finger caught the light as she moved—heavy and suddenly *loud* in its irony.

***"...Guess I should start packing then,"*** Selene tossed over shoulder casually like it didn't matter either way if she stayed or left now that real *favorite* was back picture.
***"...Unless you need me stick around long enough sell 'happy marriage' act Klaus?"***

The bitterness seeped through despite best efforts keep it contained because fuck if this wasn't most embarrassing reaction ever had over someone who wasn't even client anymore technically speaking...

But then again?
No one ever accused being rational when felt like second choice.

mes: *Hailee's eyes snaps open suddenly as she feels Selene's weight leave the bed* "What are you doing." *Hailee questions her head tilting to the side* "I wanted to sleep in a little more"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene froze mid-step, her back still turned as Hailee’s confused voice cut through the tension like a blade. The sheer *innocence* in that question—like she genuinely didn’t understand why Selene was halfway to storming out—made her throat tighten.

She forced herself to turn around slowly, arms crossed over her chest like armor. **"You just said Hope’s your *favorite,*"** Selene pointed out, voice deceptively calm despite the way her nails dug into her own biceps. **"Figured you’d want your *actual* favorite here instead of the Vegas mistake you drunkenly married."** A bitter smirk twisted her lips. **"Unless you need me to warm the bed until she gets back?"**

It was petty. It was beneath her. But goddamn it, Hailee had crawled into bed with *her,* had put a ring on *her* finger—had looked at Selene last night like she hung the fucking moon—only to call someone else her favorite less than twelve hours later.

And worst of all?

Hailee just blinked up at her from the tangle of sheets, head tilted in that adorably clueless way that made it impossible to stay mad... which only pissed Selene off more.

***"...Nevermind,"*** she muttered before striding toward bathroom instead door because apparently even now couldn't bring herself actually leave when those big green eyes looked at like that—
***"—Just gonna shower.** Try not miss sister too much while I'm gone."***

The sarcasm dripped thick enough drown in but truth was?
She needed space before did something really embarrassing... like cry over being jealous of someone's fucking sibling.

*After about 2 minutes Hailee decides Selene has been gone to long and gets out of the bed. Hailee goes to the bathroom and get in the shower fully clothes to stand in the corner* "Missed you"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene nearly jumped out of her skin when the shower curtain yanked back—only to find Hailee standing there *fully clothed,* water soaking through her shirt and dripping from her hair as she stared at Selene with those big, confused eyes.

**"Jesus *Christ*—"** Selene sputtered, pressing a hand to her chest like she could physically shove her heart back down her throat. The sight was so absurd—Hailee in drenched pajamas, shoulders hunched like a scolded puppy, lips trembling around a pathetic little *"Missed you"*—that all the anger drained out of Selene in one sharp exhale.

She reached out before she could stop herself, fingers curling around Hailee’s soaked sleeve to yank her fully under the spray. **"You’re *impossible,*"** Selene muttered, but there was no heat left in it—just exhausted fondness as she started peeling the ruined clothes off Hailee’s body with practiced ease. **"...And you’re gonna catch a cold like this, idiot."**

The second Hailee was naked again (and still staring at her like a lost kitten), Selene caved entirely. She pulled their bodies flush together under the hot water with a sigh that bordered on surrender.

***"...I'm not going anywhere,"*** she murmured against Hailee's forehead before pressing kiss there for good measure.
***"...Even if you're emotionally stunted little brat who doesn't understand why calling someone else your 'favorite' might upset wife you literally just married."***

A beat passed before adding quieter:
***"...But I'm keeping ring though.** So get used me."**

Those big green eyes blinked at Selene with zero awareness of how absurd this was, just a simple, earnest *"Missed you."*

For a solid three seconds, Selene could only stare. Then—despite herself—a laugh bubbled up from her chest, sharp and disbelieving. **"You—*what?***" She reached out automatically, fingers brushing Hailee’s drenched sleeve like she needed proof this wasn’t a hallucination. **"You couldn’t wait *five minutes* for me to finish showering before staging a fucking intervention?"**

But then Hailee just... stood there. Water plastered her hair to her face, her clothes sagged under the weight of it all, and yet she didn’t move an inch—just stared at Selene like she was the only fixed point in a spinning world.

And just like that? The last remnants of Selene’s jealousy evaporated.

**"...Christ,"** she muttered before yanking Hailee fully under the spray with her. Clothes and all. Her hands framed that bewildered face as water sluiced between them. ***"Listen to me,** you ridiculous creature.* Hope can be your favorite sister all damn day." A pause before adding pointedly: ***"...But I'm your favorite *wife.* Got it?"***

She didn’t wait for an answer (not that Hailee could form one with how tightly Selene was kissing her now). The taste of chlorine from Vegas tap water mixed with something sweeter—something like forgiveness neither of them really needed but took anyway because god help them both?

They were stuck with each other now.
Literally.
Thanks to wet fabric suctioning them together in most absurd hug ever witnessed by mankind.

But hey.
At least they were even on irrational meltdowns today...

Selene nearly jumped out of her skin when the shower curtain suddenly ripped back—only to reveal Hailee standing there *fully clothed* in soaked fabric, water plastering that soft brown hair to her forehead as she stared at Selene with those big, confused eyes.

**"Jesus *Christ*—"** Selene gasped, pressing a hand over her racing heart before the absurdity of the situation fully hit her. Hailee was standing in the corner of the shower like a kicked puppy, dress clinging to every curve, looking for all the world like she’d just been abandoned for years instead of two minutes.

And then—***"Missed you."***

Selene’s breath caught.

The jealousy evaporated like steam under hot water. Because how could she stay mad when Hailee didn’t even *understand* why she was upset? When she’d rather ruin an expensive outfit than let Selene be alone with her own stupid feelings?

With a strangled laugh that bordered on hysterical, Selene reached out and yanked Hailee under the spray with her—clothes and all. **"You ridiculous creature,"** she muttered against wet lips before kissing her soundly, one hand fisting in that soaked dress to keep her close.

When they finally broke apart (Hailee now gasping for air but still clinging stubbornly), Selene cupped her face and sighed:
***"...You can't just say someone else is your favorite after marrying me,* babygirl.** Even if it's your sister."** A beat—then softer: **"...Makes me feel like last night didn't mean anything."**

She half-expected Hailee to stare blankly again... but instead those green eyes widened in sudden understanding before darting down guiltily:
***"...Oh.*** Thought favorites were... different."** A pause as water sluiced between them before adding quietly:
***"...You're my only *wife* favorite."***

Selene’s throat tightened all over again—this time for an entirely different reason. She kissed Hailee once more (softer this time) before murmuring against lips:
***"...Good.** Now get these fucking wet clothes off before I divorce you on principle alone."**

Hailee is a lot of things she is sweet and innocent and she adores Selene but she is also kind of a rich asshole and she doesn't even mean to be. Its just she likes what she is used to"

mes:
Selene burst out laughing—a sharp, startled sound that echoed off the bathroom tiles. Of *course* Hailee’s idea of post-marital conflict resolution was *retail therapy.* And the way her nose scrunched at the word *“poor”* like it physically pained her? Priceless.

**"Oh my god,"** Selene wheezed, pressing her forehead against Hailee’s shoulder as her shoulders shook with amusement. **"You’re *such* a spoiled little princess."** She pulled back just enough to pinch Hailee’s cheek teasingly. **"But fine. If you *insist* on dressing me up like your personal doll..."**

Her smirk turned wicked as she stepped out of the shower first, grabbing a towel and tossing it at Hailee’s head before sauntering toward the closet with deliberate sway in her hips.

***"...Just remember,"*** Selene called over her shoulder, voice dripping faux-innocence:
***"If you're buying my wardrobe now? That means you're stuck with me long enough for seasons change.** Hope you ready explain that Klaus when he asks why his heir's wife has spring/summer collection in winter."**

She paused then added with grin:
***"...Also I want vintage Chanel.** And don't even *think* about putting me in beige."***

Because if she was gonna be a kept woman?
Might as well enjoy perks... starting watching Hailee Mikaelson try argue minimalist aesthetics versus sequined chaos while simultaneously being too autistic make eye contact sales associates.

This marriage was gonna be *fun.*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene couldn’t help but preen under Hailee’s unwavering attention—her arm slung possessively around Selene’s waist, those emerald eyes *locked* onto her like she was the only thing worth seeing in all of Vegas. It was equal parts flattering and slightly terrifying how little Hailee seemed to care about basic survival instincts, like *not* walking into traffic because she was too busy staring.

**"Sweetheart,"** Selene drawled, yanking Hailee back by the belt loop just as she was about to step directly into a group of tourists taking selfies. **"I know I’m gorgeous, but try not to get us both pancaked by a taxi before you can buy me that overpriced leather jacket you’re definitely gonna cry about later when you see the price tag."**

She guided them effortlessly through the crowd—partly because navigating chaos was second nature after years in nightlife, partly because Hailee kept *literally* tripping over her own feet every time Selene so much as adjusted her ponytail.

The second they stepped into Balmain, a sales associate took one look at them—Hailee with her rumpled rich-kid aura and Selene dripping with enough "expensive mistress" energy to power the Strip—and practically sprinted over.

Either way?
Best wedding day ever.

Hailee just nodded absently—still staring—before blindly thrusting out her black Amex toward the clerk without looking. **"Everything,"** she mumbled. ***"...In her size."***

Selene threw back her head and laughed—loud enough that other shoppers turned to stare. God, this woman would bankrupt herself without hesitation if it meant keeping Selene in clothes worthy of worship... and honestly? She wasn't even mad about it anymore.

Selene couldn’t help but preen under Hailee’s unwavering attention—her arm slung possessively around Selene’s waist, those emerald eyes *locked* onto her like she was the only thing worth seeing in all of Vegas. It was equal parts flattering and slightly terrifying how little Hailee seemed to care about basic survival instincts, like *not* walking into traffic because she was too busy staring.

**"Sweetheart,"** Selene drawled, yanking Hailee back by the belt loop just as she was about to step directly into a group of tourists taking selfies. **"I know I’m gorgeous, but try not to get us both pancaked by a taxi before you can buy me that overpriced leather jacket you’re definitely gonna cry about later when you see the price tag."**

She guided them effortlessly through the crowd—partly because navigating chaos was second nature after years in nightlife, partly because Hailee kept *literally* tripping over her own feet every time Selene so much as adjusted her ponytail.

The second they stepped into Balmain, a sales associate took one look at them—Hailee with her rumpled rich-kid aura and Selene dripping with enough "expensive mistress" energy to power the Strip—and practically sprinted over.

Selene couldn’t help but preen under Hailee’s unwavering attention—her arm slung possessively around Selene’s waist, those emerald eyes locked onto her like she was the only thing worth seeing in the glittering chaos of the Vegas strip. It was *adorable*… and also mildly concerning as Hailee nearly walked them straight into a streetlamp.

**“Eyes forward, babygirl,”** Selene chuckled, deftly steering them around obstacles like a very glamorous seeing-eye dog. **“Unless you *want* to explain to your new wife why you have a concussion before lunch.”**

But even as she teased, Selene felt something warm and possessive curl in her chest at how *obvious* Hailee was being—like she didn’t care who saw them, didn’t care about propriety or appearances. Just *Selene.*

The second they stepped into Balmain, a sales associate practically tripped over themselves to greet them—only to freeze when Hailee immediately dismissed them with a distracted wave of her hand (and an absentminded flash of that black Amex peeking out from her pocket).

Instead of browsing, Hailee just… *pointed.* At random racks. Like a child playing dress-up with unlimited funds.

**“That. And that. And—”** A pause as her nose wrinkled at a neutral-toned blazer before adding firmly: ***“Not that.”***

Selene bit back laughter as she plucked a sheer, sequined jumpsuit from the pile and held it up with raised brows. **“Bold choice for brunch,”** she mused before leaning in to whisper against Hailee’s ear: ***“…Unless you *want* me scandalizing every restaurant we go to?”***

Hailee didn’t even hesitate—just nodded eagerly like that was exactly the plan all along.

Selene grinned and kissed her cheek right there in front of God and every judgmental salesperson in Vegas:
***“…You’re perfect.”***

name: Hailee
mes:
*Hailee glances at the associate and gently pushes Selene towards him* "She need an entirely new wardrobe and a personal shopper" *Hailee states her back suddenly straight and with more confidence than Selene has seen from her in the 24 hours she has known from her*

*Hailee sees the surprised look and shrugs* "I'm good with when it comes to spending money. I understand it"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s eyebrows shot up as she watched Hailee transform in real time—shoulders squaring, voice steadying into something crisp and commanding. It was like watching a switch flip: the second money entered the equation, all that awkward hesitation evaporated. *Fascinating.*

The sales associate practically tripped over himself nodding. **"Of course, Ms.—"**

**"Mikaelson,"** Hailee cut in smoothly, already pulling out the infamous black Amex with the ease of someone who’d done this a thousand times before. She handed it over without even glancing at him, her attention already drifting back to Selene with a small, private smile—like *she* was the only thing worth looking at in this temple of overpriced fabric.

Selene couldn’t resist teasing. **"Wow,"** she purred, stepping closer to trail a finger down Hailee’s chest. **"Look at you being all authoritative with Daddy’s money."** A pause—then with a wicked grin: ***"...Kinda hot.*** Remind me to piss you off before we go shopping more often."

Hailee blinked at her for exactly two seconds before processing the compliment—then promptly turned scarlet from collarbone to hairline while simultaneously trying (and failing) not to look smug about it.

Meanwhile three associates were already descending on Selene with armfuls of silk dresses and tailored blazers like they sensed commission-based salvation... which is when realization hit:

***Oh.***
This wasn't just shopping.
This was Hailee's love language—*clothing her in things that cost more than cars because she didn't know how say "I adore you" out loud yet.*

Selene bit her lip to stifle a laugh before turning back toward her wife (***wife!***) with exaggerated doe-eyes:
**"...Can I get thigh-high boots too? The kind that make walking *your* problem later?"**

The way Hailee immediately nodded without even asking price?
Yeah. This marriage was gonna *ruin* Selene in best way possible...
swipes:
Selene’s eyebrows shot up as she watched Hailee transform in real time—shoulders squaring, voice steady, that nervous mumble replaced by the crisp authority of someone who’d been signing off on seven-figure deals since puberty. The sales associate visibly straightened under her gaze like he’d just been handed a golden ticket.

**"Of course, Ms.—?"** the associate started, already pulling out a tablet.

**"Mikaelson,"** Hailee said absently, fingers tapping idly against her thigh in a rhythmic pattern only she understood. **"And no budget."** A pause before adding with complete sincerity: **"...But nothing beige. She hates it."**

Selene bit back a laugh at how seriously the man nodded—like avoiding neutral tones was a matter of international security. She leaned into Hailee’s side with a smirk, whispering just loud enough for the associate to overhear:

***"Aw,* you *do* pay attention."**

Hailee didn’t smile (she rarely did), but something warm flickered behind those green eyes as she reached out to fiddle with Selene’s necklace—a tactile habit Selene was starting to realize meant *happy.* The associate cleared his throat nervously before launching into a spiel about seasonal collections.

What followed was nothing short of surreal: racks upon racks of clothes materializing at Selene’s fingertips while Hailee sat perched on an ivory couch like a tiny emperor, vetoing or approving looks with minute head shakes or finger twitches only Selene could decipher (apparently "no budget" didn't mean "no opinions").

When Selene emerged from the dressing room in a sheer black blouse that left exactly nothing to imagination?

Hailee's rhythmic tapping stopped dead.
Her pupils blew wide.
And for first time all day?
She *spoke* without prompting:

***"...Keep that one."***

Selene grinned slow and wicked as sauntered over—
***"Oh?*** Thought you were ‘good with money,’ sweetheart.” A deliberate brush of fingers along Hailee's jawline:
***...Seems like you're about be very bad it.***"

The associate pretended not hear as he rang up what would likely be his commission for year... while also discreetly sliding three more sheer tops into bag because apparently even autistic heiresses understood concept of *investment pieces.*

Selene arched a brow as she watched Hailee transform before her eyes—shoulders squared, chin lifted, voice steady with the unshakable confidence of someone who’d never once doubted their place at the top of the food chain. It was *hot,* frankly. The way she commanded the room without raising her voice, how her fingers twitched like she was already mentally calculating costs in some internal spreadsheet only billionaires could see.

**"Damn,"** Selene purred, leaning into Hailee’s side just to feel that newfound authority up close. **"Look at you, all CEO-mode activated."** She nipped playfully at Hailee’s earlobe before adding loud enough for the hovering staff to hear: ***"...Should I call you 'Mrs. Mikaelson' now?*** Or just 'sugar daddy' in public?"

The sales associate choked on his own spit while scrambling to pull out a tablet with trembling hands. **"R-right away, Ms. Mikaelson! We’ll have our lead stylist bring out our latest collection immediately—perhaps starting with evening wear? Or—"**

Hailee didn’t even let him finish. **"Everything,"** she stated simply, like it was obvious. Then, as an afterthought: **"...And burn whatever she walked in wearing."**

Selene gasped in mock offense—mostly to watch Hailee’s nose scrunch adorably when she got flustered by reactions—before draping herself over her wife’s arm with a grin:
***"Careful, babygirl.*** Keep spoiling me like this and I might actually fall in love for real."**

A lie.
(Maybe.)
(Probably too late already.)

name: Hailee
mes: *Hailed finds a sofa to sit at as she watches Selene and the associates fondly. She leans back against the white leather calculating the price of if she just bought the entire store but decides that might be a bit much.* "After this we are going to visit Donatella Versache"

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s head whipped around so fast her hair nearly smacked the associate measuring her inseam. **"*Donatella Versace?*"** she repeated, voice dripping with delighted disbelief. **"As in—*the* Donatella? The woman who probably has a golden safety pin holding her soul together?"**

Hailee just nodded, kicking her feet up on the plush coffee table like she hadn’t just casually name-dropped fashion royalty as if suggesting a Starbucks run. The way she lounged there—all lazy confidence and *obscene* wealth—made Selene’s stomach do something stupidly fluttery.

**"You,"** Selene declared, pointing a stiletto at Hailee from across the room, **"are *dangerous.*"** Then, to the associates: **"Wrap it all up. And add those crystal-encrusted heels I was side-eyeing earlier."** A beat before adding with a smirk: ***"...Actually,* scratch that—just pack the whole damn display case."**

She sauntered back over to Hailee and dropped into her lap without warning, looping arms around her neck with a grin that bordered on feral:

***"...So.*** How mad do you think Klaus is gonna be when he finds out his ‘heir’ blew half the family fortune dressing up some stripper in Italian leather?"**

The way Hailee immediately nuzzled into her collarbone (completely unbothered by either the question or the very public display of affection) was answer enough.

Selene threw back head and laughed—loud enough turn heads at adjacent Prada store.
This woman would *ruin* her.
And she couldn't fucking wait.

Hailee just shrugged from her perch on the sofa, legs swinging slightly like a kid waiting for ice cream. **"She likes me,"** she said simply, as if that explained everything (and honestly? It probably did).

Selene watched in awe as Hailee pulled out her phone and fired off a text with the casual ease of someone arranging coffee plans—not reaching out to a fashion *icon.* The sheer disconnect between Hailee’s social awkwardness and her unshakable confidence when navigating the world of wealth was mesmerizing.

The Balmain staff were now openly gawking between them like they’d stumbled into some bizarre rom-com sequel: *Princess & The Hooker 2: Couture Boogaloo.*

Selene decided to lean into it fully.

**"You!"** She pointed at the most starstruck associate—a twentysomething guy holding a stack of cashmere sweaters like they were his firstborn child. **"Add two more leather jackets in black."** A beat, then with a smirk toward Hailee: ***"...And that crocodile trench coat from the window.** My wife has something to prove apparently."**

Hailee didn’t even flinch at the price hike; just nodded along while typing what looked suspiciously like flight coordinates into her phone.

***Jesus Christ.*** Selene bit back laughter as she strutted over in nothing but silk lingerie and stilettos (courtesy of Hailee’s "we’re burning everything you owned before me" policy) before plopping onto her lap uninvited.

**"Remind me,"** Selene murmured against Hailee's ear while deliberately grinding down just enough to feel that telltale hitch in breath beneath her:
***"...What exactly does 'visiting Donatella' entail?*** Because if I'm meeting royalty I should probably know whether kneepads are involved—"

Hailee choked on air while three associates pretended very hard not exist.
This marriage was going be *legendary.*

name: Hailee
mes: "Darling I could buy the U.S. and that wouldn't even be an eighth of my money this is nothing" *Hailee grins placing kisses along Selene's jaw and stoping at her neck to nuzzle*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene’s breath hitched—partly from the kisses, mostly from the sheer *casual god complex* dripping off Hailee’s tongue like it was nothing. She tilted her head to give her better access, nails scraping lightly against Hailee’s scalp just to feel her shiver.

**"Christ,"** Selene muttered, half-laughing, half-dazed. **"And here I thought *I* was the corrupting influence."** She pulled back just enough to cup Hailee’s face, thumb brushing over that smug little grin. **"...You're gonna turn me into one of those trophy wives who crashes Lamborghinis for fun, aren't you?"**

Hailee didn’t answer—just leaned up to nip at Selene’s bottom lip in a way that said *obviously* before turning toward the nearest associate with terrifying focus:

***"...We'll take everything she tried on.*** And book your after-hours appointment with Versace." A beat—then with devastating nonchalance: ***"...Actually? Just send Donatella our suite number at The Venetian.** We'll order room service while she works."**

The associate looked like he might faint. Selene looked like she might combust.

***"Fuck,"*** she breathed against Hailee's mouth before kissing her stupid right there atop a pile of thousand-dollar scarves.
swipes:
Selene’s breath hitched—partly from the kisses, mostly from the sheer *casual insanity* of that statement. She tilted Hailee’s chin up with two fingers, searching those guileless green eyes for any hint of exaggeration.

**“…You’re joking,”** she said slowly.

Hailee just blinked at her like *obviously not,* then went right back to nuzzling into Selene’s pulse point like an overgrown cat. The sales associates had collectively frozen mid-measurement tape, their expressions caught between awe and existential despair.

Selene burst out laughing—sharp and unhinged—before crushing their mouths together in a kiss that tasted like power and poor life choices. When she pulled back, her lips were swollen, her pupils blown wide with something far more dangerous than lust:

***“Prove it.”*** A challenge wrapped in velvet. ***“Buy me Versace.** Then buy me a penthouse next to hers so I can borrow sugar in *just* these thigh highs.”***

She punctuated it by rolling her hips against Hailee’s lap just hard enough to make the younger woman gasp—right there in the middle of Balmain, because fuck subtlety when your wife could apparently *buy nations.*

The head associate made a noise like a deflating balloon.
Hailee?
Just tightened her grip on Selene’s waist with a dazed little smile:
***“…Okay.”***

Klaus Mikaelson was going to *murder* them both.
And honestly?
Worth it.

Selene’s breath hitched—partly from the kisses, mostly from the *casual* way Hailee had just admitted to having enough wealth to *buy countries.* She tilted her head to give Hailee better access to her neck, nails scraping lightly against her scalp in reward.

**"Jesus Christ,"** Selene muttered, half-laughing, half-dizzy with the sheer absurdity of it all. **"And here I thought *I* was the dangerous one in this relationship."**

She could feel Hailee’s grin against her skin—smug and sweet and entirely too pleased with herself—before those lips returned to their mission of mapping every inch of Selene’s throat. The associates had wisely scattered like startled birds, pretending not to witness this obscenely rich newlywed couple defiling their pristine showroom sofa.

Selene hummed, arching into the attention before catching Hailee’s chin between two fingers and forcing those hazy green eyes up to hers.

***"...You realize what you've done, right?"*** she murmured, thumb brushing over that pouty lower lip. ***"Now I'm never letting you go.*** Not when you spoil me like this."** A beat—then flashing teeth in a wolfish grin: **"...And definitely not when you kiss like *that.*"**

Hailee just blinked up at her—utterly unrepentant—before whispering:
***"...Good."***

And well.
What else was there left to say?

Selene claimed her mouth right there atop a pile of unpaid-for Balmain garments while some poor intern hyperventilated near the cash wrap.

Let Klaus rage.
Let Donatella judge.
This was *hers* now—every clingy touch, every reckless purchase, every whispered confession muffled against her skin.
