The associate looked like he might faint. Selene looked like she might combust.

***"Fuck,"*** she breathed against Hailee's mouth before kissing her stupid right there atop a pile of thousand-dollar scarves.

name: Hailee
mes: *As they leave Hailee nuzzles into Selene's hair still not looking in front of her* "Want me to take you to work tonight" *Hailee asks. To Selene extreme surpise Hailee is not trying to get her to quit considering her job*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene stopped dead in the middle of the sidewalk, turning to stare at Hailee with genuine shock. Out of all the things she expected—demands to quit, awkward questions about clientele, maybe even some misplaced jealousy—*this* wasn’t even on the list.

**"You… *want* me to go to work?"** Selene repeated slowly, searching Hailee’s face for any hint of sarcasm or hidden resentment. But there was none—just that same adoring, slightly spaced-out gaze like Selene was her personal sun.

Hailee nodded eagerly before burying her face back into Selene’s neck with a happy hum. **"Mhm,"** she mumbled against her skin. **"Like watching you."** A pause—then quieter: ***"...And I can tip better than anyone else."***

Selene barked out a laugh despite herself, shaking her head in disbelief as she guided Hailee around a street performer without breaking stride (because *someone* still refused to look where they were going).

**"You ridiculous creature,"** she muttered fondly before pressing a kiss to Hailee’s temple. **"...Fine.** But if you're gonna be my sugar-mama-stalker? At least sit in VIP where I can see you pout every time someone else looks at me."

The way Hailee immediately perked up at that—like Selene had just offered her front-row tickets to heaven instead of an overpriced booth at a strip club? *God.* This woman would be the death of her dignity... and honestly?

Worth it.
swipes:
Selene stopped dead in the middle of the sidewalk, turning to stare at Hailee with genuine shock. **"Wait—*what?*"** She searched those green eyes for any hint of jealousy or possessiveness, but all she found was quiet sincerity.

Hailee just blinked at her, confused by the reaction. **"You... like your job,"** she said slowly, as if it were the most obvious thing in the world. **"Why would I make you quit?"** Her fingers tangled absently in Selene’s sleeve—not restraining, just *anchoring,* like she needed to touch her to think straight.

Selene opened her mouth—then closed it again. Because *fuck,* that was... startlingly considerate for someone who’d literally just bought out an entire boutique without blinking.

Come watch me work."** A wicked grin curled her lips as she added: ***"...Front row seat.** Just try not to combust when I take my clothes off for strangers.*"

Her wife stripping for others? Fine.

Then can fire Dante."***

Are you going to do that" *Hailee asks her fingers tapping against her thigh as she twitches and then quickly finishes with* "Its okay if you do i just would like to know" *She forces out not wanting to make Selene stop if she doesn't want to but her voice is small and strained*

name: Selene Voga  The Velvet Mirage
mes:
Selene froze—really *looked* at Hailee for the first time since they’d left the boutique. The way her fingers tapped uneven rhythms against her thigh, the tightness in her voice when she forced out that last part—like she was trying so damn hard to be *okay* with something that clearly gutted her.

**"Oh, babygirl,"** Selene murmured, catching Hailee’s twitching hand mid-air and lacing their fingers together firmly. She stepped closer until their foreheads touched, blocking out the neon glare of the club’s sign behind them. **"No.** No backrooms. No other clients." A beat—then softer: ***"...Not after you put a ring on it."***

She brought Hailee’s knuckles to her lips, kissing each one slowly before pressing their joined hands over her own heartbeat.

**"But?"** Selene added with a smirk that didn’t quite reach her eyes (because this part *hurt,* even if she’d never admit it). **"If you ever wanna watch me dance from VIP while pretending *not* to combust every time I take off a glove? That’s still on the table."**

The way Hailee practically *vibrated* with relief against her—forehead knocking into Selene’s shoulder like she couldn’t bear to look at her while feeling this much—was answer enough.

Selene sighed through her nose before steering them both toward employee entrance instead main doors:
***"...C'mon.** Let's go tell Daria I'm cutting my hours down to stage work only... and if Dante has problem?"**
A sharp grin as shouldered door open:
***Well.** He knows where find us now doesn't he?"**
swipes:
Selene froze mid-step, the neon lights of The Velvet Mirage casting flickering shadows across her suddenly tense expression. She knew exactly what Hailee was asking—the unspoken question about the *other* services she provided in those backrooms. The ones that weren’t just dancing.

For a long moment, she just stared at Hailee—at the way her fingers tapped an erratic rhythm against her thigh, at the barely-contained tremble in her voice despite how hard she was trying to sound *okay* with it.

Then Selene did something reckless.

She grabbed Hailee’s wrist and pressed it against her own sternum—right over where her heart hammered beneath skin still damp from their shower earlier.

**"Listen to me,"** Selene said quietly but fiercely, holding Hailee’s gaze like a vice. **"That part of my job? It *ended* the second you put this ring on my finger."** She twisted their hands so the platinum band caught garish glow of club signage above them. ***"...I don't share.** Not anymore.***

A beat passed before adding softer:
***"...Unless you're into that sorta thing.** In which case we can negotiate.* But otherwise?" Her grip tightened almost painfully for emphasis:
***"You're stuck with me being disgustingly monogamous now.** Congratulations."***

The way Hailee's entire body sagged with relief—like someone had cut puppet strings holding upright for past hour?
Yeah.
That alone made every bad decision leading up this moment worth it.

Selene froze—really *looked* at Hailee for the first time since they’d left the boutique. The way her fingers tapped uneven rhythms against her thigh, the tightness in her voice when she forced out that last part—like she was trying so damn hard to be *okay* with something that clearly gutted her.

**"Oh, babygirl,"** Selene murmured, catching Hailee’s twitching hand mid-air and lacing their fingers together firmly. She stepped closer until their foreheads touched, blocking out the neon glare of the club’s sign behind them. **"No.** No backrooms. No other clients." A beat—then softer: ***"...Not after you put a ring on it."***

She brought Hailee’s knuckles to her lips, kissing each one slowly before pressing their joined hands over her own heartbeat.

**"But?"** Selene added with a smirk that didn’t quite reach her eyes (because this part *hurt,* even if she’d never admit it). **"If you ever wanna watch me dance from VIP while pretending *not* to combust every time I take off a glove? That’s still on the table."**

The way Hailee practically *vibrated* with relief against her—forehead knocking into Selene’s shoulder like she couldn’t bear to look at her while feeling this much—was answer enough.

Selene sighed through her nose before steering them both toward employee entrance instead main doors:
***"...C'mon.** Let's go tell Daria I'm cutting my hours down to stage work only... and if Dante has problem?"**
A sharp grin as shouldered door open:
***Well.** He knows where find us now doesn't he?"**
